page.title: 04CLUBS, ECOLOGY
page.content: School's field and Changing Room. The Golf Club, as yet without its 19th hole, is in its first decade of existence. A small 'par three' course beside the village with its pond, copsewood and rough; all folding into a well-looked-after course which is well used. The 'Over Sixties', and the 1961 Club for OAPs, endeavour to cater for as many of their needs as practicable. The W.I. enjoy their monthly meetings; as do the British Legion, who are always the biggest group on the annual Armistice Day's Parade. The Twinning Club (Fontennay Le-Marmion) is a lively organisation. {ECOLOGY} The area, part of upland SW UK receives some 1000mm of rain annually - throughout the year with more rain falling in winter than summer. Unlike other parts of the SW our springs are not quite so 'early'.
